# Navitas Semiconductor Corporation (NVTS) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Navitas Semiconductor Corporation is a power-semiconductor company engaged in designing, developing and marketing power semiconductors, including gallium nitride (GaN) power integrated circuits (ICs), silicon carbide (SiC) power devices, associated silicon system controllers and digital isolators used in power conversion and charging. The company's products are used in mobile phones, laptops, consumer electronics, data centers, solar inverters, and electric vehicles and various other applications. The company was founded in 2014 and is based in Torrance, California, formed to enable a high-speed revolution in power electronics. Navitas makes this revolution possible with the invention of the industry's first Gallium Nitride (GaN) power ICs which enable up to a 100x increase in switching speeds while increasing energy savings by 3x or more.

Navitas Semiconductor is a next-generation power semiconductor leader in gallium nitride (GaN) and IC integrated devices, and high-voltage silicon carbide (SiC) technology, founded in 2014 as the only pure-play, next-generation power-semiconductor company. With more than 30 years of combined expertise in wide bandgap technologies, GaNFast™ power ICs integrate GaN power, drive, control, sensing, and protection, delivering faster power delivery, higher system density, and greater efficiency. GeneSiC™ high-voltage SiC devices leverage patented trench-assisted planar technology to provide industry-leading voltage capability, efficiency, and reliability for medium-voltage grid and infrastructure applications. Navitas has over 300 patents issued or pending and is the world's first semiconductor company to be CarbonNeutral®-certified.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

Navitas offers gallium nitride power integrated circuits, silicon carbide power devices, silicon system controllers, and digital isolators for power conversion and charging. GaNFast™ power ICs integrate GaN power, drive, control, sensing, and protection, delivering faster power delivery, higher system density, and greater efficiency. GeneSiC™ high-voltage SiC devices leverage patented trench-assisted planar technology to provide industry-leading voltage capability, efficiency, and reliability for medium-voltage grid and infrastructure applications.

The company has shipped more than 240 million GaN and 30 million SiC devices, with field failure rates well below one part per million—an industry benchmark for reliability. Navitas' GaNFast power ICs integrate power, drive, control, sensing, and protection in a single chip, enabling faster charging, higher power density, and up to 40% energy savings versus traditional silicon.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Navitas' new 100 V GaN FET portfolio delivers superior efficiency, power density, and thermal performance in advanced dual-sided cooled packages. These FETs are specifically optimized for the lower-voltage DC-DC stages on GPU power boards, where ultra-high density and thermal management are critical to meet the demands of next-generation AI compute platforms. Additionally, these high efficiency 100V GaN FETs are fabricated on a 200 mm GaN-on-Si process through a new strategic partnership with Power Chip, enabling scalable, high-volume manufacturing.

Navitas is about to release a new bidirectional GaN device. Bidirectional technology is gaining more attention, as it will enable significant device count reduction in some topologies for power conversion and is likely to be adopted for industrial applications first.

GeneSiC ultra-high voltage 2.3 kV to 6.5 kV targets megawatt-level new energy markets for EV roadside fast chargers, energy storage, renewable and grid infrastructure upgrades.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Navitas Semiconductor's (NASDAQ: NVTS) "Navitas 2.0" strategic pivot marks a truly pivotal moment in the company's trajectory, refocusing its efforts squarely on the burgeoning high-power artificial intelligence (AI) markets. Despite the immediate market reaction, the company's decisive move towards AI data centers, performance computing, and energy infrastructure positions it as a critical enabler for the next generation of AI. The "Navitas 2.0" strategy signals a deliberate shift away from lower-margin consumer and mobile segments, particularly in China, towards higher-growth, higher-profi[tability segments].

Navitas recently reported third-quarter 2025 results with a shift in focus from consumer markets to high-power segments such as AI data centers and industrial electrification. This shift, while causing a 41% year-over-year revenue decline in the first three quarters of 2025, reflects a calculated move to focus on high-growth, high-margin sectors such as AI data centers, electric vehicles (EVs), and industrial electrification.

Navitas ends Q3 2025 with $151 million in cash and no debt, ensuring a strong balance sheet to support its strategic pivot.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

A unique aspect of Navitas' positioning was its recognition by NVIDIA as a power semiconductor partner for next-generation 800V DC AI factory architectures. The company's partnership with NVIDIA to support next-generation 800V DC architectures for AI factory computing underscores its alignment with the power demands of AI workloads.

The company is collaborating with NVIDIA and other leaders in the AI data center and energy infrastructure sector.

Announced GaNSafe technology qualification to the challenging Q101 standard and adoption in the industry's first GaN EV on-board charger production design with Changan, a top EV maker in China and is on-track for a production ramp in early '26.

Recent partnerships include NVIDIA for 800V HVDC architectures, Enphase for next-generation IQ9 with GaNFast ICs, and Changan Automobile for GaN-based on-board chargers.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

In 2024, Navitas Semiconductor's revenue was $83.30 million, an increase of 4.84% compared to the previous year's $79.46 million. Losses were -$84.60 million, -41.83% less than in 2023.

Q1 2025 results showed unaudited financial results for the first quarter ended March 31, 2025, with CEO Gene Sheridan noting "Our first quarter featured many industry firsts, including the world's first production release of GaN bi-directional ICs, a 12 kW AI data center power supply platform and unprecedented reliability standards for both GaN and SiC technology."

Navitas reported Q2 2025 financial results with revenue of $14.5 million, down from $20.5 million in Q2 2024. The company reported third quarter 2025 revenue of $10.1 million, meeting the midpoint of their guidance, with a gross margin of 38.7%.

For the fourth quarter, Navitas anticipates revenue of $7 million, attributing the decline to a strategic exit from the China mobile market to redirect resources to high-power sectors. The company projects Q4 to mark the bottom in revenue, expecting gradual growth throughout 2026 as it pivots away from consumer and mobile markets.

## 8. Market Shares

The power GaN device market is currently led by Innoscience, which had a 31% share of the market in 2023, Power Integration (PI), which accounted for 17%, and Navitas Semiconductor, which held 16%. Navitas currently leads in GaN among emerging competitors as the silicon-based market transitions to novel materials.

The company estimates a $2.6B market potential by 2030 for GaN and SiC technologies in AI data centers. Broader industry forecasts see GaN/SiC markets rocketing from $3.3 billion in 2025 to over $54 billion by 2035—growing about 32.5% each year. The global GaN and SiC power semiconductor market was worth about $3.29 billion in 2025, with forecasts suggesting it could balloon by over 30% a year for the next decade.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

Key competitors include Infineon, STMicroelectronics, ON Semiconductor, Texas Instruments, and Power Integrations. While these firms have greater scale and broader portfolios, they remain heavily invested in legacy silicon. Unlike most rivals, Navitas is a pure-play in these next-generation materials, with no legacy silicon business to dilute focus or resources.

Other players include EPC, which is exclusively active in supplying low-voltage devices, as well as the likes of Transphorm and Infineon Technologies. In view of the recent M&As announced in the power GAN industry, like Infineon Technologies' acquisition of GaN Systems and Renesas' announcement regarding the acquisition of Transphorm, we foresee a change in this ranking in the future. Infineon Technologies' share will increase.

Key competitors include Wolfspeed and Infineon, among others, who are also investing in GaN and SiC technologies. The competitive landscape for GaN semiconductors is dynamic, with major players like Infineon and Wolfspeed.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

Navitas has partnered with Powerchip to produce and develop 200mm GaN-on-silicon technology at Powerchip's Fab 8B facility in Taiwan, using an improved 180nm CMOS process. The production will take place at Powerchip's Fab 8B facility in Zhunan Science Park, Taiwan, utilizing an improved 180nm CMOS process.

Initial device qualification is expected in Q4 2025, with 100V family production starting in 1H26. The 650V devices will transition from TSMC to Powerchip over the next 12-24 months.

Navitas Semiconductor announced a long-term partnership with GlobalFoundries in mid-November.

The company announced a strategic shift focusing on AI data centers and energy infrastructure, supported by a $100 million capital raise through the sale of 20 million common shares.

## 11. Recent Developments

TORRANCE, CA – Oct 13th, 2025 — Navitas announced progress in its development of advanced medium and high 800 VDC voltage GaN and SiC power devices to enable the 800 VDC power architecture announced by NVIDIA for next-generation AI factory computing platforms.

The company has already made substantial progress, releasing the world's first 8.5 kW AI data center power supply unit (PSU) with 98% efficiency and a 12 kW PSU for hyperscale AI data centers achieving 97.8% peak efficiency, both leveraging GaN and SiC and complying with Open Compute Project (OCP) and Open Rack v3 (ORv3) specifications.

TORRANCE, CA – February 11, 2025— Navitas announced that it will report fourth quarter and full year 2024 financial results after the market close on Monday, February 24th, 2025. Management will host a conference call and live webcast.

The company announced $450M of design wins for 2024, positioning the company for important growth later this year and in 2026 and beyond.

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Buy Rating: 7.2/10**

**Estimated Fair Value: $12.50 per share**

**Investment Rationale:**

The rating of 7.2/10 reflects strong upside potential balanced against execution risks. Navitas' recognition by NVIDIA as a power semiconductor partner for next-generation 800V DC AI factory architectures stands out, spotlighting practical progress in targeting high-power applications and supporting one of the company's most important upcoming catalysts: stronger traction in AI and performance computing markets.

**Key Strengths Supporting Higher Rating:**
- Technological leadership in GaN and SiC power semiconductors with over 300 patents and first-mover status in GaN/SiC position it to capture share as the industry transitions away from silicon
- The recent NVIDIA partnership adds momentum to the investment narrative, positioning Navitas as a potential supplier at the heart of AI infrastructure
- High-Growth Market: GaN and SiC power chips are in a market that's expanding by more than 30% a year, with strategic partnerships teaming up with giants like NVIDIA for data centers confirming the tech works and opens doors to massive sales
- Strong balance sheet with $151 million in cash and no debt

**Risk Factors Limiting Rating:**
- Customer concentration risk (Distributor A was 56% of 2024 revenue), supply chain dependence, and the need to scale manufacturing
- Revenue decline bottoming out in Q4 2025 with growth expected in 2026 - execution of "Navitas 2.0" strategy is critical
- The 12-month analyst price target is $6.4, which represents potential downside from current levels, though this may not fully account for AI catalyst developments

The $12.50 fair value estimate reflects the company's transition from legacy consumer markets to high-growth AI infrastructure applications, supported by the NVIDIA partnership and the expanding $54 billion GaN/SiC market opportunity through 2035. The strategic pivot to "Navitas 2.0" positions the company to capture significant value from AI data center power infrastructure needs, justifying a premium valuation for investors with growth appetite and moderate risk tolerance.

The company is executing a strategic "Navitas 2.0" pivot towards high-power AI and infrastructure markets, moving away from consumer electronics. With over 300 patents and a groundbreaking partnership with NVIDIA for 800V DC AI factory architectures, Navitas is positioning itself at the forefront of next-generation power semiconductor technology. The GaN/SiC market is projected to grow 32.5% annually, reaching $54 billion by 2035, with Navitas holding a 16% market share. Recent technological achievements include the world's first 12 kW AI data center power supply unit and development of bidirectional GaN devices.

With a buy rating of 7.2/10 and a fair value estimate of $12.50, Navitas represents a high-potential investment in emerging power semiconductor technologies, balanced against execution risks.
